questions.question:
Question 1: A pregnant woman has come for her first antenatal visit at 10 weeks of gestation. How many 
more antenatal visits does she require to fulfill the minimum requirements as per the 
Maternal and Child Health program?
questions.explanation:
This patient requires 3 more antenatal visits in order to fulfill the minimum requirements 
according to the Maternal and Child Health Program (MCH). The minimum number of antenatal visits according to MCH is 4. • 1st visit – within 12 weeks, preferably as soon as the pregnancy is suspected. • 2nd visit – between 14 and 26 weeks 464 
Sold by @itachibot • 3rd visit – between 28 and 34 weeks • 4th visit – between 36 weeks and term The minimum number of antenatal visits according to the WHO is 8. Ideally, pregnant women 
should attend antenatal visits according to the following schedule: • Once a month during the first 7 months • Twice a month during the 8th month • Once a week, thereafter if everything is normal.

questions.question:
Question 2: You are a medical officer in a PHC. A pregnant woman comes to you for regular follow-up 
during her second trimester. Which of the following will you prescribe for her?

options.a: 100 mg elemental iron + 500 mcg folic acid
options.b: 100 mg elemental iron + 100 mcg folic acid
options.c: 50 mg elemental iron + 500 mcg folic acid
options.d: 60 mg elemental iron + 500 mcg of folic acid

questions.explanation:
As per the Anemia Mukt Bharat program, pregnant women should be given 60 mg of elemental 
iron and 500 mcg of folic acid in the II trimester. It should be started from the 4th month of 
pregnancy and continued for 180 days post-partum.

questions.question: Question 3: Which of the following vaccine is contraindicated in pregnancy?
questions.explanation:
Varicella vaccine is contraindicated in pregnant women as it is a live vaccine. The live attenuated varicella virus vaccine is currently recommended for children between 12 to 18 
months of age who have not had chickenpox.

questions.question:
Question 4: What is the average weight gain during pregnancy in Indian women with inadequate calorie 
intake? 456 
Sold by @itachibot
questions.explanation:
Weight gain during pregnancy in women with inadequate calorie intake is around 5 - 6 kgs. Normally, a woman is expected to gain around 9-11 kgs of weight during pregnancy. An 
inadequate dietary intake can be suspected if the woman gains < 2 kg/ month.

questions.question: Question 5: Which of the following is incorrect about congenital syphilis?

options.a: It can be prevented by procaine penicillin administration
options.b: Infection of fetus most commonly occurs in the 1st trimester
options.c: Neurological damage with mental retardation is a serious complication
options.d: Chances of transmission are lower if mother has late syphilis

questions.explanation:
The chances of transmission of syphilis during pregnancy is highest after 6th month of gestation. 
It does not occur before the 4th month. It is routine to test the mother for syphilis in antenatal clinics during her first visit. The chance of 
infection of the fetus is higher when the mother is suffering from early (primary or secondary) 
syphilis and are lower in case of late syphilis. Neurological damage with mental retardation is a 
serious complication of congenital syphilis. It can be prevented by procaine penicillin 
administration. 465 
Sold by @itachibot

questions.question:
Question 6: The District Maternal Death Review Committee is reviewing the number of maternal deaths 
in the district during 2020. In order to calculate the maternal mortality ratio, what other 
parameter is required?

options.d: Total women in child bearing age

questions.explanation:
The maternal mortality ratio is calculated using the number of maternal deaths and total live 
births.

questions.question:
Question 7: Which of the following maternal deaths is not included when calculating the maternal 
mortality ratio?

options.a: Death of a 30-year-old woman following spontaneous abortion at 11 weeks of gestation
options.b: Death of a 24-year-old woman due to ruptured ectopic pregnancy
options.c: Death of a 26-year-old woman following a road traffic accident at 36 weeks of gestation
options.d: Death of a 21-year-woman following secondary PPH on postpartum day 14

questions.explanation:
The death of a pregnant woman following a road traffic accident is not included when calculating 
the maternal mortality ratio. It includes all deaths anytime during pregnancy or within 42 days of 
termination from any cause related to or aggravated by the pregnancy.

questions.question:
Question 8: 457 
Sold by @itachibot What is the most common cause of maternal deaths in India?
questions.explanation: The most common cause of maternal deaths in India is hemorrhage.

questions.question:
Question 9: In a town, there were 2500 live births in a period of 6 months. During the same period, 15 
women died due to the following causes. What is the maternal mortality ratio?
questions.explanation:
The maternal mortality ratio (MMR) of this town is 400 per 100,000 live births. Maternal mortality refers to deaths during pregnancy or 42 days within termination, from causes 
related to pregnancy. Hence, in this town, there were 10 maternal deaths (peripartum infection, 
PPH, obstructed labor). MMR = Number of maternal deaths in a period x 100,000 / Number of live births in the same 
period Hence, MMR = 10 x 100000/2500 = 400 per 100,000 live births

questions.question:
Question 10: A baby was delivered at home in a village. Until which day of life should an ASHA worker 
visit this baby?
questions.explanation:
Under the Home Based Newborn Care (HBNC) guidelines, ASHA workers should visit all 
newborns up to 42 days of life, according to the following schedule. During her visits, ASHA workers must record weight, ensure vaccination, and registration of 
births. On completion of all these visits, they receive an incentive of Rs. 250. Mode of delivery 
No. of visits

days 1, 3) 466 
Sold by @itachibot

questions.question:
Question 11: What is the best indicator of obstetric and neonatal care given before and around the time of 
birth?
questions.explanation:
The perinatal mortality rate is the best indicator to evaluate obstetric and neonatal care given 
before and around the time of birth.

questions.question: Question 12: What is the 2030 target of the India Newborn Action Plan with regards to the stillbirth rate?
questions.explanation:
The India Newborn Action Plan targets to achieve a stillbirth rate of < 10/ 1000 live births and 
neonatal mortality rate of < 10/ 1000 live births (single-digit SBR and NMR) by 2030. This program was launched to reduce preventable newborn deaths and stillbirths. It provides the 
following: • Pre-conception and antenatal care • Care during labor and childbirth • Immediate newborn care • Care of healthy newborn • Care of small and sick newborn • Care beyond newborn survival

questions.question:
Question 13: A group of health workers are conducting a perinatal mortality audit in a hospital. Which of 
the following must they take into account to calculate the perinatal mortality rate?
questions.explanation:
The perinatal mortality rate (PMR) is calculated using the following parameters during a 
particular time period: • Late fetal deaths or stillbirths > 1000 g - correlates to 28 weeks of gestation • Early neonatal deaths - from birth to 7 days of life • Live births > 1000 g The neonatal mortality rate (NMR) refers to the deaths within the first 28 days of life. It is 
calculated using the following parameters: • Early neonatal deaths • Late neonatal deaths - after 7th day but before 28th completed day of life

questions.question:
Question 14: In a given population, 4050 births were recorded over a period of 1 year. Among these, 50 
were stillbirths, 50 died in the 1st week of life and 150 died within 8-28 days of life. What is 
the neonatal mortality rate of this population?
questions.explanation:
The neonatal mortality rate (NMR) of the given population is 50 per 1000 live births. 467 
Sold by @itachibot Neonatal mortality rate = No. of deaths of neonates < 28 days within a year x 1000 / Total live 
births in the same year In this population, there were 4000 live births (no. of total births - no. of stillbirths). NMR = (50+150) x 1000/4000 = 100/2 = 50

questions.question: Question 15: Which of the following is the leading cause of neonatal mortality?
questions.explanation: Prematurity is the leading cause of neonatal mortality.

questions.question:
Question 16: In children aged 1 month to 1 year, all of the following are common causes of mortality 
except:
questions.explanation:
Tetanus is not a common cause of mortality in children between the age of 1 month to 1 year 
(post-neonatal period). The main causes of post-neonatal deaths are diarrhea, respiratory 
infections, and malnutrition.

questions.question:
Question 17: In a given population, there were 5100 births during the year 2020. Of these, 100 babies were 
stillborn. Among the living children, the following deaths were recorded. Calculate the infant 
mortality rate for this population.
questions.explanation:
The infant mortality rate (IMR) for this population is 100 / 1000 live births. IMR = No. of deaths within 1st year of life over a period of time x 1000 / No. of live births in the 
same period In this population, there were 5000 live births (5100 – 100) and 500 deaths within the 1st year of 
life. Hence, IMR = 500 x 1000/5000 = 100 per 1000 live births

questions.question: Question 18: Which of the following is true for a newborn stabilization unit?

options.a: It is located in the delivery room.
options.b: It is for sick babies and LBW babies < 1800 g
options.c: It is present in all community health centres
options.d: All cases except major surgeries are managed here

questions.explanation:
A newborn stabilization unit is present in all community health centers (CHC). India accounts for 30% of neonatal deaths globally and 73.3% of these deaths occur in 1st week of 
life. To address this issue, the following facility-based newborn care services were introduced: Newborn care corner

questions.question:
Question 19: You are a doctor at a child health clinic. You will consider all of the following children as 
at-risk infants except:

options.b: A 15-day-old baby with birth weight of 2.4 kgs
options.d: An 8-month-old baby being raised by a working mother

questions.explanation:
The 2-month-old baby with 3 older siblings has a birth order of 4. Infants with birth order of 5 or 
more are considered at-risk infants. The following are considered at-risk infants: • Birth weight < 2.5 kgs • Twins • Birth order of 5 or more • Artificial feeding • Weight below 70% of the expected weight • Failure to gain weight during 3 successive months • Children with protein-energy malnutrition (PEM), diarrhea • Working mother or single parent

questions.question:
Question 20: A researcher is calculating the child survival indices for different populations. Which of the 
following should he use for calculating the same?
questions.explanation:
The under-5 mortality rate is used in the calculation of the child survival index. It is calculated 
as (1000 – Under-5 mortality rate)/10.

questions.question: Question 21: Identify the false statement about the following tool:

options.a: Malnutrition can be detected even before signs and symptoms appear
options.b: It provides an objective basis for policy making on child healthcare
options.c: It can be used to teach the importance of adequate feeding
options.d: It can be used to indicate proof of government aid

questions.explanation:
The given image shows a growth chart. It is not used as proof of government aid. The uses of growth charts are as follows: • Growth monitoring and diagnosis - can detect malnutrition before clinical features appear • Educational tool - to teach parents about the importance of adequate feeding. 469 
Sold by @itachibot • Objective basis for planning and policy-making on child healthcares

questions.question:
Question 22: 461 
Sold by @itachibot A juvenile delinquent was sentenced by the court to be placed in a center under the care of a 
doctor and psychiatrist. Which of the following fulfills this requirement?
questions.explanation:
A remand home is an establishment where children are placed under the care of a doctor, 
psychiatrist and other trained personnel. An orphanage or shelter home is an institution where children who have no home or parents or 
for some reason can’t be cared for are placed. Foster homes are arrangements where a family or a couple takes care of a child on a temporary 
basis. Borstal is a place that falls between a certified institution and a prison. It is where boys > 16 
years who have misbehaved or are too difficult to handle are sent.

questions.question:
Question 23: The police authorities rescued a girl from being trafficked for sexual exploitation. She is 
identified to be a refugee. As a part of the Ujjawala scheme, which of the following benefits 
will she not receive?
questions.explanation:
The girl will not receive remuneration (monetary compensation) under the Ujjawala scheme. The Ujjawala scheme was launched to combat women and child trafficking in India. The 
components of the scheme include: • Prevention of trafficking by awareness, vigilance, education • Rescue of victims from the place of exploitation • Rehabilitation of victims • Re-integration of victims into their family and society • Repatriation of cross-border victims to their place of origin Some other legislations associated with children in India are: • The Right of Children to Free and Compulsory Education Act, 2009 • Juvenile Justice (Care and Protection of Children) Act, 2000 • Child Labour (Prohibition and Regulation) Act, 1986 (amended in 2006 and 2016) • Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO), 2012 under the National Commission for 
Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) • Prohibition of Child Marriage Act, 2006

questions.question:
Question 24: A 4-year-old girl was brought by her parents who tell you that she fell down while playing. On 
examination, bruises and ecchymoses of varying ages are noted all over the body. An x-ray 
showed a spiral fracture of the right femur. Which of the following programs can provide 
support services to this child and prevent further such incidents?
questions.explanation:
The given clinical scenario points towards child abuse. The INSPIRE strategy was introduced 
to eliminate such violence against children and also provide support services. It refers to a set of 7 evidence-based strategies to eliminate violence against children: 470

questions.question:
Question 25: As a PHC medical officer, which of the following groups would you target as a part of Kishori 
Shakti Yojana?
questions.explanation:
The Kishori Shakti Yojana (KSY) program is aimed at adolescent girls (11-18 years). This program is a component of the Integrated Child Development Services (ICDS) scheme and 
is a redesign of the already existing Adolescent Girls (AG) scheme. The objectives of KSY are: • To improve the nutrition, health, and development status • To promote awareness on health, hygiene, nutrition, and family care • To teach life skills and encourage school attendance • To help understand their social environment • Aspects aimed at empowerment and enhanced self-perception • To help them take initiatives to become productive members of society It also fosters convergence with other sectoral programs, addressing the interrelated needs of 
adolescent girls and women. 471 
Sold by @itachibot

questions.question: Question 26: The school health programs are managed by which of the following?
questions.explanation:
The school health programs are managed by the primary health center (PHC). The School Health Committee (1961) in India recommended that the school health services should 
be a part of the general health services administered through PHCs. Formation of school health 
committees at the village, block, district, state, and national levels was recommended. The 
National School Health Council was created as an advisory and coordinating body. PHCs provide the following school health services: • Screening and general assessments for - • Anemia/nutritional status • Visual acuity and hearing problems • Dental check-up • Physical disabilities • Learning disorders and behavior problems • Basic medicines for common ailments • Immunization • Micronutrient management (vitamin A, iron, and folic acid) • Deworming • Mid-day meal

questions.question:
Question 27: A 68-year-old man visits your outpatient clinic for a routine follow-up. Which of the following 
protocols would you use to assess his health literacy?
questions.explanation:
The SPEAK protocol is used to assess health literacy in the geriatric population in a clinical 
setting. Health literacy is defined as the degree to which individuals have the capacity to obtain, process, 
and understand basic health information needed to make appropriate health decisions. The 
SPEAK protocol provides a simple framework that healthcare providers can use to assess literacy. 
SPEAK stands for: • S - Speech • P - Perception • E - Education • A - Access • K - Knowledge Option A: The GATHER approach is mainly used for counseling (usually, family planning and 
reproductive counseling) to help people make decisions about health. It stands for: 472 
Sold by @itachibot • G – Greet • A – Ask • T – Tell • H – Help • E – Explain • R – Return Option C: The SPIKES protocol is used to convey distressing information and break bad news in 
an organized manner to patients and families. It stands for: • S - Setting • P - Perception • I - Invitation or information • K - Knowledge • E - Empathy • S - Summarizing or strategizing. Option D: The S-BAR technique is used for prompt and appropriate communication among health 
care workers in hospital settings. It stands for: • S - Situation • B - Background • A - Assessment • R - Recommendation

questions.question: Question 28: Which of the following comes under the Rashtriya Varishth Jan Swasthya Yojana?

options.a: Proteins must constitute 15-30% of the daily energy intake
options.b: Fats must constitute 10-15% of the daily energy intake

questions.explanation:
The establishment of super-specialty geriatric departments for training, guidelines, and referral 
comes under the Rashtriya Varishth Jan Swasthya Yojna (RVJSY). It refers to the tertiary 
component of the National Programme for Healthcare of the Elderly (NPHCE). The NPHCE was established for geriatric care and includes provisions at primary, secondary, and 
tertiary levels. The tertiary component of the program has been renamed as RVJSY and has the following 
provisions: • Geriatrics departments at 20 super specialty institutions- • 30-bedded inpatient facility and referral treatment • Research and manpower development, • Development of training, IEC material, and guidelines • Geriatric units at district hospitals (tertiary) - • 10 bedded geriatric ward 473
